uk.gov.gchq.palisade.config.service

Class Configurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.gov.gchq.palisade.config.service.Configurator

  • public class Configurator
extends Object
    A Configurator is responsible for creating Palisade Services either from a supplied ServiceConfiguration or by connecting to a ConfigurationService and retrieving the configuration from there.

    No parameter may be null.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Configurator(ConfigurationService service)
      Create a Configurator object that retrieves configuration from the given service.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveConfigAndCreate

        public <S extends Service> S retrieveConfigAndCreate(Class<S> serviceClass,
                                                     String... overridable)
                                              throws NoConfigException
        Attempts to connect to the configuration service to get the configuration for the named service class. It will then create the class and configure it based on the given information. This method will repeatedly try to connect to the configuration service until a call succeeds.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of service
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the service class type to create
        overridable - array of regex for properties that can be overridden from system properties
        Returns:
        a created service
        Throws:
        NoConfigException - if no configuration for the service type could be found
        See Also:
        createFromConfig(Class, ServiceConfiguration, String...)

      • retrieveConfigAndCreate

        public <S extends Service> S retrieveConfigAndCreate(Class<S> serviceClass,
                                                     Duration timeout,
                                                     String... overridable)
                                              throws NoConfigException
        Attempts to connect to the configuration service to get the configuration for the named service class. It will then create the class and configure it based on the given information. This method will repeatedly try to connect to the configuration service until a call succeeds or the given duration expires.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of service
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the service class type to create
        timeout - the length of time to try to retrieve a configuration before failing
        overridable - array of regex for properties that can be overridden from system properties
        Returns:
        a created service
        Throws:
        NoConfigException - if no configuration for the service type could be found, or the operation timed out
        See Also:
        createFromConfig(Class, ServiceConfiguration, String...)

      • createFromConfig

        public static <S extends Service> S createFromConfig(Class<? extends Service> serviceClass,
                                                     ServiceConfiguration config,
                                                     String... overridable)
                                              throws IllegalStateException
        Create a Palisade service from the given configuration. This method will look up the implementing class name for the given service class from the configuration, attempt to create it and then call Service.applyConfigFrom(ServiceConfiguration) on the object.

        Certain keys and values can be overridden in the ServiceConfiguration from Java system properties. By default none can be overridden, but by specifying regex patterns to this method, clients can allow certain properties to be overridden. For example, providing a single entry of ".*" would allow all properties to be overridden.

        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of service
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the type of service class to create
        config - the configuration to create the service from
        overridable - array of regex for properties that can be overridden from system properties
        Returns:
        a created service
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the service class could not be created, if the implementing class name couldn't be looked up, or the instance can't be configured properly from the given configuration
        See Also:
        System.getProperties()

      • applyOverrides

        public static ServiceConfiguration applyOverrides(ServiceConfiguration config,
                                                  String... overridable)
        Allows for certain keys in the ServiceConfiguration to be overidden from values from Java system properties. Any of the regular expressions provided in overridable that match a key in the configuration key and values pairs will be replaced with the identically named system property if it exists
        Parameters:
        config - the configuration to copy from, this object is not modified
        overridable - the array of regular expressions to allow overriding for
        Returns:
        a new configuration object

      • retrieveConfig

        public ServiceConfiguration retrieveConfig(Optional<Class<? extends Service>> serviceClass)
                                    throws NoConfigException
        Retrieves the initial configuration for a given service class. This will communicate with the configuration service to try and get the configuration details for the given service class. If no service class is provided (empty optional) then the client configuration will be retrieved. This method waits indefinitely for the configuration to respond.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the optional service class to retrieve data for
        Returns:
        the configuration data
        Throws:
        NoConfigException - if no configuration data can be retrieved
        Implementation note:
        This is equivalent to calling retrieveConfig(serviceClass, 0).

      • retrieveConfig

        public ServiceConfiguration retrieveConfig(Optional<Class<? extends Service>> serviceClass,
                                           Duration timeout)
                                    throws NoConfigException
        Retrieves the initial configuration for a given service class. This will communicate with the configuration service to try and get the configuration details for the given service class. If no service class is provided (empty optional) then the client configuration will be retrieved. This method throws an exception if the configuration could not be retrieved in the given time specified.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the optional service class to retrieve data for
        timeout - the amount of time to wait for the configuration service to respond
        Returns:
        the configuration data
        Throws:
        NoConfigException - if no configuration data can be retrieved, or the operation timed out
